title: My mum won't buy me a drum set, which is understandable, they're expensive. So I'm saving up to buy it myself. Is there anything that I can practise with in the meantime? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can get practice pads for pretty cheap- I’ve also seen practice pad setups in music stores with multiple pads that’s in the form of an actual set, so that might be good too, not sure how much they’ll cost though. For really cheap, you can always use things like plastic bins with a t-shirt over them or cardboard boxes. My dad even said that he used to practice on top of the cardstock record album sleeves.

Grab some sticks and a practice pad. That’s a pretty cheap investment that will allow you to work on your mechanics. Also - it’s quiet, so mom will be happy. I’m not a drummer, but this is what my son does for practice when away from his real kit.
